name: Harvard University
about: Founded in 1636, Harvard University is a private Ivy League research university located in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Renowned for its academic excellence, it offers a diverse range of programs across various disciplines. Harvard is committed to fostering a community of scholars dedicated to addressing global challenges through research, education, and leadership.
summary: Harvard University is a prestigious institution known for its rigorous academic programs and distinguished faculty.

name: University of Bologna
about: Founded in 1088, the University of Bologna is the oldest university in the Western world and a leading public research institution. Renowned for its historic academic tradition and innovative programs, it pioneered the Bologna Process, which standardizes higher education across Europe.
summary: A globally ranked institution (Top 150 in THE 2025) with strengths in law, medicine, and engineering, offering a vibrant international student community.

name: University of Melbourne
about: Founded in 1853, the University of Melbourne is Australia's top-ranked public research university and a member of the prestigious Group of Eight (Go8). Renowned for its academic excellence, it offers a wide range of programs across disciplines like medicine, law, engineering, and arts. The university is globally recognized for its research output, industry collaborations, and vibrant international community, with over 30,000 international students from 130+ countries:cite[3]:cite[4]:cite[5].
summary: Consistently ranked #1 in Australia (THE 2025) and top 40 globally, known for strong employability and research in medicine, law, and AI:cite[3]:cite[7].

name: The University of Tokyo
about: Founded in 1877 as Japan's first imperial university, the University of Tokyo (UTokyo) is a public research university renowned for its academic rigor and global impact. It ranks #1 in Japan (QS 2025) and #29 globally (THE 2025), with strengths in STEM, law, and humanities. UTokyo pioneered Japan's modern higher education system and has produced 11 Nobel laureates, including physicist Yoichiro Nambu.
address: 7 Chome-3-1 Hongo, Bunkyo City, Tokyo 113-8654, Japan
summary: Japan's most prestigious university, leading in research output and global collaborations, with a unique two-campus liberal arts-to-specialization model.
accommodation: On-campus dormitories (e.g., Komaba International Lodge) and off-campus housing

name: University of Pisa (Università di Pisa)
about: Founded in 1343, the University of Pisa is one of Europe's oldest and most prestigious public research universities. As part of the Pisa University System (alongside Scuola Normale Superiore and Sant'Anna School), it excels in both teaching and cutting-edge research.
summary: Among top 350 globally; Top 100 in key subjects like Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, and Classics

name: University of Milan (Università degli Studi di Milano)
about: Established in 1924, the University of Milan is one of Italy's leading public universities and the only Italian member of the LERU (League of European Research Universities). It is highly regarded for its teaching quality, research output, and international collaborations.
address: Via Festa del Perdono, 7, 20122 Milano MI, Italy
summary: Ranked among the Top 300 globally with strengths in Life Sciences, Medicine, and Data Science

name: University of Florence (Università degli Studi di Firenze)
about: Founded in 1321, the University of Florence is one of Italy's oldest and most respected public research universities. It is well known for its historical significance, wide academic offerings, and contributions to scientific and cultural advancement.
summary: Ranked among the Top 350 globally with strengths in Architecture, Engineering, and Environmental Sciences

name: University of Pavia (Università degli Studi di Pavia)
about: Established in 1361, the University of Pavia is one of the oldest universities in Europe. Known for its strong research orientation, it offers a broad range of academic disciplines and has a long-standing tradition of hosting international students. It is part of the EC2U Alliance and promotes global academic cooperation.
summary: Ranked among the Top 450 globally with strengths in Medicine, Engineering, and Molecular Biology

name: University of Messina (Università degli Studi di Messina)
about: Founded in 1548, the University of Messina is one of Italy's historic public universities, located in the scenic coastal city of Messina, Sicily. Known for its research and international collaboration, it offers a wide range of academic programs across various fields with a growing focus on English-taught degrees and student mobility.
summary: Ranked in the Top 1000+ globally with strengths in health sciences, engineering, law, and humanities

name: University of Genoa (Università degli Studi di Genova)
about: Founded in 1481, the University of Genoa is one of the most prestigious and historic public universities in Italy. Located in the beautiful coastal city of Genoa (Liguria region), UniGe is renowned for its excellence in engineering, maritime sciences, architecture, and international collaborations.
summary: Ranked in the Top 700 globally with strengths in Naval Engineering, Robotics, and Architecture

name: University of Turin (Università degli Studi di Torino / UniTo)
about: Founded in 1404, the University of Turin is one of the oldest and most prestigious public universities in Italy. It is located in Turin, the capital of the Piedmont region, and is well known for its excellence in law, economics, political science, humanities, sciences, and medicine.
summary: Ranked among the Top 450 globally with strengths in Law, Economics, and Medicine

name: University of Siena (Università degli Studi di Siena / UniSi)
about: Founded in 1240, the University of Siena is one of the oldest public universities in Italy and Europe. Located in the charming Tuscan city of Siena, it is especially renowned for its programs in medicine, law, economics, biotechnology, and humanities.
summary: Ranked among the Top 800 globally with strengths in Medical Biotechnologies and Artificial Intelligence

name: University of Milano-Bicocca (Università degli Studi di Milano-Bicocca / UniMiB)
about: Established in 1998, the University of Milano-Bicocca is a modern public university in Milan, Italy. It was created to relieve overcrowding at the University of Milan and quickly gained a reputation for innovation, high-quality teaching, and interdisciplinary research.
summary: Ranked among the Top 500 globally with strengths in Psychology, Data Science, and Astrophysics

name: PSL University (Paris Sciences & Lettres)
about: Founded in 2010 and officially granted university status in 2019, PSL is a prestigious public collegiate research university based in the heart of Paris. It comprises 11 elite constituent schools and draws on centuries of academic excellence, including institutions like École Normale Supérieure, Collège de France, and Mines ParisTech.
summary: Ranked #28 globally (QS 2026), #1 in France with strengths in Natural Sciences and Humanities

name: Paris-Saclay University (Université Paris-Saclay)
about: Established through a merger and official university status in 2019, Paris-Saclay University is a public, research-intensive institution located just south of Paris. It forms the core of the prestigious Paris-Saclay scientific and technology cluster.
summary: Ranked #70 globally (QS 2026) with strengths in Mathematics (#2 global) and Physics (#3 global)

name: Sorbonne University (Sorbonne Université)
about: Established in 2018 by merging Paris-Sorbonne (Humanities) and Pierre & Marie Curie (Sciences & Medicine), Sorbonne University traces its roots back to the 13th century through the original University of Paris and Collège de Sorbonne (1257).
summary: Ranked #72 globally (QS 2025); #3 in France with strengths in Humanities (#30 global) and Physical Sciences (#48 global)

name: Université Paris Cité
about: Founded in 2019 through the merger of Paris Descartes and Paris Diderot, Université Paris Cité is a multidisciplinary public university focused on sciences, medicine, law, humanities, and social sciences.
summary: Ranked #300 globally (QS 2026); #4 in France with strengths in Biomedical Engineering and Neuroscience

name: Aix-Marseille University (AMU)
about: Aix-Marseille University, often abbreviated as AMU, is one of the largest multidisciplinary universities in France. Though officially founded in 2012 through the merger of three universities (Provence, Mediterranean, and Paul Cézanne), it traces its origins back to 1409.
summary: Top 300 globally (QS 2025); largest student population in French-speaking world with strengths in Marine Sciences and Medicine

name: Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA)
about: Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA) is a leading French public university with strong international and research reputation. It was formally established in 2016, merging several institutions, but its academic roots go back to 1339. It is located in Grenoble, a scenic Alpine city known for science, innovation, and student life.
summary: Top 300 globally (QS 2025); strong in Physics, Nanotechnology and Environmental Science with 35+ English-taught Master's programs

name: University of Strasbourg (Université de Strasbourg)
about: The University of Strasbourg (Unistra) is one of the most renowned public universities in France and across Europe. It was officially reconstituted in 2009, though its academic history dates back to 1538, making it one of the oldest universities in the country. It is especially strong in research, medicine, chemistry, and humanities.
summary: Top 300 globally (QS 2025); member of LERU with Nobel Prize-winning Chemistry faculty and 60+ English-taught programs

name: University of Montpellier (Université de Montpellier)
about: Founded in 1220, the University of Montpellier is one of the oldest universities in the world and a leader in health, science, and technology. Re-established in 2015 after merging Montpellier 1 and Montpellier 2, it has gained a reputation as a dynamic institution at the crossroads of innovation and tradition.
summary: Ranked Top 500 globally (QS 2025); #1 in Ecology worldwide with world's oldest operating medical school

name: University of Bordeaux (Université de Bordeaux)
about: The University of Bordeaux, re-established in 2014 after merging Bordeaux 1, 2, and 4, is one of France's largest and most prestigious public universities. With a strong focus on multidisciplinary research, it is internationally recognized in neuroscience, digital technology, health, and wine science.
summary: Top 500 globally (QS 2025); member of IdEx Bordeaux with strengths in Neuroscience and Wine Science

name: Claude Bernard University Lyon 1 (Université Claude Bernard Lyon 1)
about: Claude Bernard University Lyon 1, commonly known as Lyon 1, is one of France's top institutions for science, technology, health, and sports science. Founded in 1971, it is named after the famous physiologist Claude Bernard and forms part of the University of Lyon, a higher education and research cluster in southeastern France.
summary: Top 450 globally (QS 2025); strong in Biomedical Sciences with 20+ English-taught Master's programs
